com.cloudant.sync.indexing

Class QueryBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cloudant.sync.indexing.QueryBuilder

  • public class QueryBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

    QueryBuilder builds a query, represented by a Map, which can be used in IndexManager.query(java.util.Map). The following query types are supported:

    1. Match a given field to a specified value.
    2. Match given field to multiple values.
    3. Range query.

    Each index can have a single criterion defined in one overarching query. The query can have criteria defined over multiple indexes. The result is an intersection of the documents matching each query criterion.

    QueryBuilder instances are not thread safe.

    See Also:
    IndexManager, Datastore

      • build

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> build()
        Returns the current state of the query in a format suitable for passing to IndexManager.query(java.util.Map).

        The return value will be updated if further calls are made to this builder object.

      • index

        public QueryBuilder index(java.lang.String indexName)
        Defines the index upon which future calls will operate.

        This method would typically be called several times when building a query, once for each index that's being used in the query.

        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.
